revised_title: Advancements in Optical and Infrared Spectroscopy: Frequency and Wavelength Standards
tldr: This article discusses the development of new techniques in optical and infrared spectroscopy, focusing on frequency and wavelength standards. The authors describe the advancements in spectroscopy, including the use of lasers and nonlinear optical devices, which have allowed for more precise measurements of frequencies and wavelengths. They also discuss the potential for redefining the international metre based on the speed of light and primary time standards.
